panels.description: The OverOps dashboard (e.g. app.overops.com) provides devs a detailed analysis of errors within the target application(s).
panels.title: OverOps Classic

panels.description: The Reliability Analysis  dashboard provides dev with a list of all new errors, increasing errors and slowdowns for a target app or deployment and direct links to their Root Cause.
panels.title: RC Analysis

panels.description: The Reliability Scorecard dashboard provides QA and Dev managers a summary of reliability scores for the selected applications, deployment and code tiers.
panels.title: Scorecard

panels.description: The Site Reliability enables SREs to observe the functionality and performance of key transactions and failure rate for target application(s) in real-time.
panels.title: Site Reliability

panels.description: The Performance dashboard enables SREs to observe the performance of transactions for target applications(s) including deviations in response tines and failure rates.
panels.title: Performance

panels.description: The Event Diff dashboard enables QA and Devs to compare any set of applications and deployments to one another to see which errors have been introduced or increased release over release or between different time periods (e.g. today vs. last week).
panels.title: Compare

panels.description: The Reliability Review dashboard enables software execs and managers to observe the trend of different reliability KPIs such as score, new errors, volume over times and compare between different applications.
panels.title: Trend ↑↓

panels.description: The Settings console enables OverOps admins to manage environment, integrations and permissions as well as customize the behaviour of the different Reliability dashboards.
panels.title: Settings

panels.description: A report providing a weighted score of the key applications, as defined in the Settings dashboard. Key applications are marked with * and appear at the top of the list followed by applications with the highest event volume up to limit of  $limit applications in total. Score weights are defined in the Settings dashboard.

panels.title: Applications

panels.description: A report detailing providing a weighted score of the selected deployments. If no deployments are selected, the $limit most recent deployments are selected. Live deployments are marked with a *. Score weights are defined  in the Settings dashboard.
panels.title: Deployments
